column1: he opens with a back of a length ball outside off, which is chopped on the back foot to backward point
pitched further up now on off, draws the batsman forward. Shahzad obliges and push-drives it to the left of the bowler
dragged short and outside off, Shahzad simply muscles a pull to the right of mid-on. The ball purrs away to the boundary

Shahzad aims to clear mid-off. No dice. Instead, he scoops a catch to mid-off running back. Shahzad backs away outside leg, collapses his back leg, and lines up for an inside-out loft. This is on a length on off stump. He checks his shot at the last instant and finds Kevin O'Brien
pretty full and veering into the pads, tickled to square leg
just short of a good length and outside off, left alone
back of a length and outside off, he ventures across the line and slugs the ball away to deep square leg
what a way to get off the mark. Stanikzai runs down the track to his first ball. Takes a half-volley and belts it in the air to the right of mid-on
good length and tucks up the batsman for room now, played back to the bowler
fuller than the previous ball, the line is outside off, front-foot drive to extra-cover
good length ball angled in at off stump, poked to the bowler running forward and to his right. The non-striker strays out in search for a non-existent single. But O'Brien can't nail the stumps down
Stanikzai rushes down the track, does so early, this is a shoulder-high rising ball, which beats the hook lavishly
tight line on off, patted into the covers for one
very full and outside off, driven with the wrists but straight to mid-on
back of a length and just outside off, swatted away to deep midwicket
two wickets in two overs for McCarthy. Back of a length and outside off, forced away in the air. Long-on runs across to his left and safely pouches the catch
back of a length on off, hangs back, opens the bat-face and dabs to cover
back of a length and outside off, flat-batted ram-rod straight down the ground, so much so it hits the stumps at the non-striker's end
full on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
back of a length and pushed really wide outside off, the batsman swishes and misses. Off-side wide
on a length on off, strides forward and taps the ball into the covers
very full on off stump, whipped to the right of mid-on
length and outside off, offcutter? Tarakai unleashes a clubbing swing and sends the ball soaring into the grass banks beyond wide long-on
too straight in line, picked off to deep square
full and wide outside off, his front foot is nowhere near the pitch. Slashes and only connects with thin air
half-volley outside off, leans into it and thrashes a drive past mid-off
fullish on off, defended to cover
good length on off, opens the face and runs it to point
full and outside off, driven on the up to  mid-off
half-volley on the pads, picked up and dispatched over midwicket. Flat six
short on off, cramps the batsman for room. Played back to the bowler
full and drifts in on middle, knocked to midwicket on the front foot
short and darted in on middle, stands tall and punches a single to long-on
tossed up full on off, no turn, worked down to wide long-on
back of a length on middle, flicked on the back foot through the midwicket region
speared flat and down leg, the batsman misses the sweep and is rapped on the front pad outside the line
short and angled in, punched down to long-on for another single
short legbreak outside off, the batsman quickly rocks back and cuts to sweeper
really full on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
another short legbreak outside off, fiercely flat-batted back to the bowler, who gets a hand to it, and absorbs the blow
worked to midwicket
half-tracker on middle, Tarakai is pretty quick to pick up the length. He skips back and launches it handsomely over midwicket for another maximum
flat and speared on the leg stump, clipped away fine of deep square leg. The man in the deep can't pull the ball back into the field of play, despite a desperate slide at the edge of the boundary
glanced off the pads in the direction of short fine leg
flatter on the pads, nudged square through the leg side again
another non-turning ball, too full for the sweep, hit on the pad, but this was sneaking down the leg side
leg-stump ball, which is tickled to short fine leg
tossed up just outside off, chipped in the air to the left of the bowler
fetch that! Tossed up on off stump, Shenwari likes the flight. He goes low and connects with a slog-sweep as the ball sails over midwicket
it makes no difference, short and wide outside off, cracked away past backward point to the boundary
full and outside off, dinked into the off side with soft hands
fuller and outside off, Shenwari loses his shape as he swings across the line. He sends a top-edge fluttering behind. The keeper settles under the skier. So pace provides the breakthrough after all
pitched up and outside off, jabbed back to the bowler
leg-side wide
very full and angled towards the leg stump, flicked away with the wrists to the right of deep square leg
back of a length on off stump, pushed into the covers on the back foot

Shafaq has been bowled around his legs! Lobbed up, dips late, which means that the batsman isn't close to the pitch as he shuffles across and does not connect with the sweep. Starts outside leg, turns, and hits the leg stump
pitched up on middle, no turn, eased down to long-off for one
straight roller on off, presses forward and pushes to cover
quicker and flatter outside off, forced away to deep cover
full-toss on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
clipped off the hips to midwicket, can't find the gap
full and drifts into the right-hander, nurdled through square leg
darted in on middle and leg, nurdled again for one
tossed up on middle, presses forward and secures a single to long-on
length ball on off stump, Tarakai sizes it up, ventures across the line and smites it into the grass banks beyond wide long-on
short and speared on the stumps, back-foot punch down to long-on
flat and no turn outside off, mis-hit back to the bowler on the front foot
short legbreak outside off, punched sweetly to sweeper cover. Tarakai brings up his maiden T20 fifty, off 34 balls
flighted legbreak on middle, opens the bat-face and drops the ball into the cover-point region
Tarakai goes big again! Floated on middle, full-toss, which is muscled over midwicket for another six. When Tarakai hits them, they stay hit
punched down the ground
full and outside off, driven down to long-off
yet another short ball, which turns away outside off, carved away to sweeper cover
nudged to square leg for one
flighted full on middle and leg, Afghanistan continue to pepper the midwicket fence. This time Janant goes low and slog-sweeps a six
short and angled in, forced to midwicket
chopped from the stumps to the left of extra-cover on the back foot
short and angled in, punched on the back foot to midwicket, who lets the ball through his legs
fractionally short and outside off, Janat eyes up the leg side and banishes the ball to the right of deep midwicket with a pull
slower offcutter outside off, he is through with the big slog early, bottom-edges it past the stumps
another slower cutter, opens the face and dabs a single to point
good length and outside off, patted into the covers, Porterfield throws himself in front at extra-cover, but still fumbles
back of a length on off, kerplunked away to long-on

Dropped at deep midwicket! Dockrell the culprit in the deep. Slower offcutter, full, messes up with the batsman's slog-sweep. Skies it in the air. Dockrell runs in from deep midwicket and shells it as he elbow lands on the ground
slower bouncer outside off, ramps and misses as the ball flies through to the keeper
very full and very wide outside off, swish and miss
full and outside off, Tarakai swings hard again, the ball takes the outside edge and streaks away fine of short third man
full and outside off, flashed through the covers
really full on off, shovelled with the bottom hand to long-on

Ireland make use of this opportunity. Porterfield shows his boys how its done. For starters this was a fine ball - yorker wide outside off.  Jant can only squeeze it to extra cover, Tarakai chances a single. Janat is caught miles short at the non-striker's end. Porterfield had only one stump to aim at. Bingo!
very full and wide outside off, past the tramline
the extra hurts Ireland. Full and outside off, swings across the line again, another outside edge streaks away to the third man boundary
chopped to point on the back foot. More indecision between the wickets, no harm done this time
full and straight on off, dinked in front of cover for a quick single now
full-toss on middle, hacked to long-on
wide legbreak outside off, reaches out with his hands and flashes the ball to the cover boundary. It would have been an off-side wide had he left it
off-stump yorker, dug back
short and spins away outside off, chopped towards backward point
full and outside off, hint of shape away from the right-hander, whistles past the outside edge of the groping bat
low full-toss on off, swatted away to deep midwicket
down the track, the bowler shortens his length, but Tarakai still swats it away over the square leg umpire, beats the fielder in the deep to his right
slower short ball on the leg stump, fine leg is inside the circle, and the batsman simply helps it away fine of that fielder

Wilson drops a skier! Possibly a slower full ball just outside off, the batsman swings across the line and top-edges it in the air. The keeper runs back, then turns to his left, but the ball swirls further away from him. Difficult chance
back of a length and outside off, Nabi gets into a stable position and swats it powerfully between deep midwicket and long-on
yorker on off, dug back to the bowler
slower full ball outside off, slogged away to deep midwicket
wild slower ball outside off, wide
full-toss outside off, Nabi brings out his carving knife and slices it over cover-point. The ball sails over the fielder in the deep. Top strike
short and wide outside off, flat-batted away to long-off
full-toss, angling away outside off, muscled away to the right of deep midwicket
three boundaries in four balls for Nabi. Very full and angling away outside off, reaches out for the ball and scythes it away to the square boundary on the off side
pitched up and outside off, flayed to long-off on the front foot
yorker just a shade outside off, jammed down the ground
full-toss outside off, drilled past the bowler, pinged off the middle to the straight boundary in front of the sightscreen
slower one wide outside off, flashes and misses in the channel
very full and wide outside off, stretches forward and shovels a drive to long-off
full on the stumps, pinged over the bowler's head again. Afghanistan move to 175

full and wide outside off, think that's a cutter, Tarakai throws his bat at the ball and slices it off a thick outside edge. Stirling tracks it down at backward point. Smart catch. No century for Tarakai, but he walks back with the second-highest score for Afghanistan in T20Is
length ball outside off, Nabi attempts to slam this across the line over midwicket. But ends up skying a catch to long-off. Fourth wicket for McCarthy
slower and cutting away wide outside off, past the wild slash, off-side wide
slower short ball outside off, hangs back and swats it away to deep midwicket
full ball, comes in on off, slower ball, Rashid looks to launch this into orbit, but loses his shape, and misses the ball

short of a length and outside off, scythed away to the left of sweeper cover. There is a miscommunication between the wickets. Rashid wants two, his partner doesn't. The throw is at the bowler's end. McCarthy flips the bails off to run Rashid out

dragged short and outside off, swatted away over deep midwicket. Two fielders converge on the ball. One of them ventures beyond the rope, collects the ball, and flicks it back into the field of play. He was past the rope and the innings ends with a six
slides on with the arm on leg, defended
pushed through on middle, defended in front of his feet
skids on with the arm, too full for the sweep, strikes the pad, but that pitched outside leg

dropped by Stanikzai at mid-off! Spills a regulation catch. Tossed up on middle and sliding away, the Afghanistan captain makes a royal mess of it. He recovers and connects with a direct hit but it's too late
full and angled in on off, pushed to cover
good length on middle from over the wicket, Stirling backs away outside leg and punches towards deep point
length ball, angled in on middle, Thompson stands tall and hoists it handsomely over the bowler's head
loose ball, loose shot. Short and wide outside off, begging on its knees to be put away. Thompson slashes it in the air and picks out backward point
very full and sliding into the pads, picked up and whipped over backward square leg
pretty full and outside off, driven to the covers on the front foot
short offcutter outside off, flat-batted to cover who dives to his right and misfields
tossed up and drifts in, shimmies out and leading-edges it to cover point
fired down the leg side, wide
short on middle and leg, shovelled to long-on
full and drifts in on off, clears his front leg and mows it over wide long-on
half-tracker just a shade outside off, pulled over wide long-on for two sixes in three balls
full on leg stump, nurdled to square leg
straying into the hips, picked up and whipped over square leg
back of a length on off stump, Stirling smashes a pull over the midwicket fence. Skipped back quickly and unleashed a powerful swing
short and slanting away outside off, slower one, Stirling swishes and misses outside off
good length and cuts away outside off, Stirling is beaten by the lack of pace as the ball jumps just past the off stump
short on middle, backs away, Stirling manufactures room and cuts to sweeper cover
hip-high short ball on the leg stump, swatted away over the square leg boundary. This is some start from Ireland. Forty-nine in four overs
outside edge and without any slip, and a third man that is too wide, Ireland raise their fifty in the fifth over. Rocket start to a chase of 185.
and the afterburners have just been switched on. Porterfield picks up a length ball and bullies it over the midwicket boundary
time for a change of pace, Porterfield adjusts his stroke, and drives along the ground to cover

races down the pitch, Sadiq fires it full, and into the pads to cut off any room for the batsman. Hits the boot and wanders into the midwicket region for a leg-bye. Sadiq is too busy straining his lungs for an appeal that is never going to be given in his wildest dreams. Ball pitched way outside leg
smashes it to mid-off, off the to of the bat
the bowling change works! Stirling swings across the line of a straight ball, looking for midwicket again, and he is essentially beaten for pace. The top of leg stump, however, is not.
spears it into the pads of the left-hander, who attempts to dink it towards square leg. No connection
massive appeal for lbw as Porterfield goes for a sweep and is hit in line with middle stump. But with such an acute angle into the batsman, this ball is always heading down leg
flatter and quicker outside off, drills it to long-off
drives a flat ball on off stump to long-off
turns this one, fired in by Nabi again, to long-on
'catch iiiiiit' is the cry as Porterfield goes for a flick a touch too early. Lobs up towards midwicket, but the fielder is on the edge of the circle. Never had a chance
nudges it past midwicket's right.
starts with a slower ball, pitching outside leg, Porterfield misses the flick and is struck on the pad
swipes a length ball on middle to midwicket
looks to go down town, but the change of pace from Sadiq does O'Brien. The slog over cow corner becomes an inside edge onto pad
ooops, the slower ball slips out of his hands and becomes a beamer. O'Brien ducks
the free hit ball is lashed over the top of point and straight into the hands of the fielder in the deep. Blistering shot from the allrounder. For one run.

offcutter, and it proves quite profitable for Afghanistan. The line is ever so straight, pesky for a batsman looking to free the arms. Porterfield moves outside leg to try and drive it over extra cover, but Rashid Khan there, times his jump perfectly to take the catch over his head
gets down on one knee and launches it to deep midwicket
good shot, but he can't pick the gap between point and short third man. Picked the quicker, shorter delivery outside off. Would be disappointed his late cut didn't result in more

googly does him. Two wickets in eight balls since the resumption. This one is the result of the legspinning slowing it down, tossing it up, and tempting O'Brien into a big hit. Aims for a slog sweep over midwicket. Misses it altogether and is bowled
quicker, flatter and fuller outside off, drives to the left of point

Is that another wicket? Afghanistan believe they have got Wilson stumped and the third umpire will have to adjudicate on it. Googly again from Rashid, nicely tossed up, to draw the batsman under pressure to hit boundaries forward. Wilson goes for a cover drive, clearly he didn't pick the variation. The ball hurtles through bat and pad, Shahzad tips the bails over ever so quickly and Wilson's foot is on the line. That means he's outta here
looks for the reverse sweep - showing every sign of his nerves, he premeditates the stroke, and the fuller, faster delivery outside off is past him before he knows it

another Irishman  goes out swinging. It's a length ball on middle, McBrine wants to smack it out of the ground. There is no time to get yourself in. Not even the time to steady this awful wobble. He has to go, and the slog to cow corner only goes as far as the fielder in the deep
they've been trying so very very hard and finally Tucker picks up a slower ball and slogs it between deep midwicket and long-on. It's all high-risk cricket
races down the pitch, gets a thick outside edge to a short delivery outside off and with third man up, Sadiq pays the price for bowling his normal pace. This is a field set for the slower ball
cramps the batsman up with a fuller delivery on middle and leg. Tucker swings from the hip, only makes contact off the thigh pad
plants a shortish delivery on leg stump into the captain's hands at extra cover
slices a full delivery, swinging into him rather late, to long-off, who comes running in off the boundary

third wicket in seven balls for the leggie. He's changed the game. Of course, having a target that forces the batsman to look for the big hits help. Here Tucker comes dancing down and pops a catch to the man at long-off
looks for the reverse sweep again, but the length ball is a little too wide for him to make proper connection
goes for the conventional sweep this time and still fails to connect

now the frustrated batsman loses his head, comes down the track and is done in by the googly. Superb bowling from Rashid. He ladled all the pressure on Thompson and then gave him a way out - the tossed up ball, but it spins in, skittles through bat and pad as he slogs, and Shahzad does the rest

appeal for lbw and it's given. Rashid has five wickets in 10 balls - on he is a hat-trick as well. Although this one seems to be a bit lucky. The debutant McCarthy goes for a sweep and is struck on the back pad. Appears to be outside the line of off stump
wanders outside off stump for a sweep, Rashid bowling a loopy legbreak, exactly where the batsman is, still beats him. That's a triple-wicket maiden
down the track, but he ends up yorking himself. Nudge to long-on for a couple. There's a direct hit at the non-strikers'. A quick check on if the run has been complete. And it is.
tosses it up outside off, because the batsman is making room outside leg, and Nabi essentially one-ups him. The ball is too wide for Mulder to make any connection
comes down and flicks a straight delivery to short fine leg
bludgeons a half-volley down the ground, and its got enough power to beat the man at long-off, to his right
length ball outside off, slugs it to long-on
steps down, Nabi throws it wide of his reach, slogs it to the right of long-on, who sends in another direct hit. Mulder's safe, but Ireland are not.
